Reviews.Title: “Love Hazleton Hotels' Staff”
Reviews.Author: tjnote
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the treatment of the Hazelton Hotels staff. Not only did they do their job of knowing who it is they are dealing with but also went out of their way to ensure that I was 100% comfortable. I had wonderful two nights stay and a spa treatment, dinner and drinks. The staff was very friendly and made me feel like one of the girls. Which I loved. Thank you Amy, Myra and Olivia. Sincerely Ms. tj note

Reviews.Title: “Flawless experience for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: MarieChristineJoly
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at The Hazelton! I very much enjoyed the room, it was very comfortable and quiet to work in. For business travelers, there is a business center with printer on each floor, which is very convenient! The experience at the Spa was flawless. I had a great manicure and was served tea and almonds as I waited for my appointment. Dean at the Concierge Desk was very helpful and gave me a warm welcome. The Hazelton is in a really pretty part of town (Yorkville), right next to Pusateri's and amazing shopping, and 10 mins away to downtown by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!! Best I've ever experienced in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: I have done many events with the Hazelton Hotel and have always had a stellar experience. No hotel has come close to the level of service I receive from The Hazelton. Hands down the best hotel experience I've had in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Singh82
Reviews.Content: I'm from Toronto originally but recently have been traveling a lot so rented out my place. I now stay at the hazel ton every time I'm in Toronto. It's in the best neighborhood in the city. Has a great dark room with a fantastic bathroom. Love One restaurant (which is very expensive in mho) but I enjoy the food so much I always go when in town. The service at the Hazelton is fantastic expect when u ask them to get the bags put of the room, they are really careful and nice but sometimes a bit to slow. Otherwise great service overall! Only hotel I will stay at when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep in a hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCooks
Reviews.Content: Although we live in Toronto, we enjoyed a mini 'stay-cation' and pampering in Yorkville. The spa staff were wonderful and the room was incredibly comfortable. I had the best nights sleep I've ever enjoyed in a hotel. The pool is a on the small side, but it seems not frequently used, so you may have it to yourself. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Thank You!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vive l
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed here with my sister a little while ago and agree that this is the best hotel in Toronto, hands down! Their Wedding staff are very courteous and make for a stressfree day. The front desk staff were amazing and even had their staff run to the 24 hr pharmacy when I feel ill during the middle of the night. There is nothing they wont do for you. Hazelton, I will be back! Thank YOU

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: Although we live only 10 minutes away, we decided to have a night on the town and booked the Hazelton. This hotel is located in the Yorkville area of downtown Toronto. Yorkville is the hip, see and be seen section. Although we are far from hip and could not care less if we are seen or see we picked this hotel based on it's high 5 star rating. The hotel delivered, for sure. The deluxe king room we had was decorated beautifully. Extremely comfortable bed dressed with perfectly smooth linens. Huge movable flat screen tv. Curtains that open and close by remote control (love that). Heated floors in the enormous decadent bathroom. TV in the bathroom mirror! Beautiful wine glasses,champagne glasses, water glasses, coffee mugs. Cuisinart coffee maker, mini fridge. Enormous closet area. Nightly turn down service. Sigh. I wish I lived here. Better than home, unfortunately. The service in this hotel is first class. Adam, at the front desk, checked us in and was the epitome of class. The concierge was also great. Other hotels could and should take notes from the service that this hotel offers. The only downfall was the restaurant One that is located in the lobby of the hotel. Pretentious and terrible service from some 20 something server dude with overpriced and mediocre food. A better bet within walking distance is to head to Spuntini's Restaurant on Avenue Rd for an amazing meal that wont break the bank. Just make reservations first.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Toronto Hands Down. Big name high end hotels have nothing on The Hazelton!! Very Big Thank You to the Front Desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay”
Reviews.Author: jonathanfarr
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel... very chic room interior with lots of beautiful furnishes... service was a 5 star or what I expected from this level of a hotel. Amazing service, we did not have to lift one finger at all. The hotel is just gorgeous and looks like they thought about everything down to the smallest detail. Friendly helpful and welcoming staffs. Best stay in this hotel. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pippy204
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after our skiing trip in Alberta. Upon Arrival the staff were great and took our bags up to the room. We were then taken up to the room and given a tour of the features which I found a little pretentious as all obvious. The deluxe room was spacious and the bathroom was great. I found the room to be very similar to Aria in Las Vegas (same space and very similar decor) most modern hotels now are of this standard. The "One" restaurant was closed for renovation and we were made aware of this two weeks before arrival. However, after the first night we had a piece of paper under our door informing us the pool was closed until the 11th Jan and was also being renovated. Poor. We chose this hotel over Le Germain for the extra benefit of the pool, so this was disappointing. I spoke to the reception about "alternative arrangements" which the letter quoted to see what they were? I don't think there was any other "alternative arrangements" as I had to suggest perhaps they had an arrangement with another hotel to use their pool? The reception called back and had arranged for us to use the Four Seasons pool which I think they should of had in place before someone asked. The hotel WIFI was also poor and regularly dropped out and one morning was not working at all. I was told it simply was not working and its being looked into after an hour later we had to go across the road to Starbucks to log on. Upon checkout we were greeted with the additions of $15 a day for "local calls" which we made none and internet charges. After pointing out we had made no local calls and the WIFI was poor they did take that off the bill. At no point was there any mention of the charge for WIFI and considering you do not have to put your room number in to connect Its an additional standard charge. Five star hotels should be building the norm such as WIFI into the price of all rooms as is a basic requirement. Having stayed at other 5 star premium hotels this one just doesn't match up. Its more a four star and on that basis would in hindsight choose Le Germain hands down.

Reviews.Title: “HANDS DOWN BEST HOTEL IN CANADA”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: I Would say I spend 40-50 days per year in hotels, not often do I have the pleasure of staying in hotels like The Hazelton. From the moment you arrive you are greeted by a team of friendly, professional, and well versed valets and it only gets smoother from there. Front desk staff had me checked in and minutes and escorted up to my room. The room was very well designed with a spectacular bathroom and closet, exceptional bed and an extensive pillow menu that almost topped the room service. In addition to the bedroom the living room is the perfect home away from home, with a great couch, flat screen and deck and chair. I also had the time for a little fitness in what felt like a private celebrity gym, top of the line equipment with fresh towels cold or room temperature water and a great steam to finish off my workout. All and all this hotel is my new home away from home. *One the restaurant in the hotel is 5*, can't miss on that menu. Enjoy, Adam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Excellent Service, Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa L
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate enough to experience staying a few nights at this fantastic hotel! Absolutely loved my entire experience, which started when I arrived with the amazing door staff, and courteous, extremely accomodating front desk staff....they started my experience here off right, and that exeperience continued throughout my stay. Beautiful rooms, great location...I really haven't had a better hotel experience in downtown Toronto than I had here. Would recommend this hotel to anyone! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Hazelton Hotel while we were in town visiting our friends. What was supposed to be a quick stay for us, it ended up being a stay to remember. The food from the One resturant was amazing. We were able to enjoy both breakfast and dinner in the resturant. Towards the end of dinner, the bar was getting very loud but it was a good way for us to end the night with our friends. The room was not a typical standard size room. My husband and I were able to both fit in the deep bath tub! The service that we recieved from the hotel was second to none. From the moment we were greeted at the door to the moment we left, the service was immpecable. We look foward to our return in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: tasadofi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue suite for 2 nights. The room and bathroom are both very luxurious. This is a totally different 5 star experience than other 5 star hotels I've stayed at around the world. It will surpass your expectations. Anything you need they have and if they dont, they will run and get it for you. To give you 2 examples, we asked for note cards (it was picked up and delivered from a local stationary store right away). I asked for a pomegranate martini, they didnt have the juice so they sent somebody to a store to pick up the juice for me and apologized for the slight wait....now I found this out after or I would have just ordered another drink. The point is they simply don't say no to you. They don't make excuses for anything. I asked for a dress to be steamed, they realized through transportation it may not be as perfect. After steaming it and sending it back they called and offered to send somebody upstairs with a steamer to steam the bottom after I put it on and make sure it was perfect. We did order room service one night and one breakfast, they were both great. We had a driver at our service our entire stay. The bathroom floors are even heated so you don't step on cold marble. I had a pedicure done at the spa and it was perfect. Their service is absolutely unparalleled. It is something out of this world. The location is perfect (right in Yorkville). They had a bottle of champagne and rose petals in the bath tub waiting for us. It impressed me as they had not done one of those tacky dove and heart displays that I find disgusting. It was minimal and tasteful. One small complaint I have is the sleep quality. My bedroom window opened on top of the restaurant One. I'm from Toronto so I know how busy it gets there on a friday night. The issue was I don't think the windows are very much sound proof. I could hear conversations clearly, It was as if they were in my bedroom. It was difficult to fall asleep (I did not complain about it however). I still do consider the Hazelton the best hotel in Toronto. They understand luxury and go above and beyond to ensure a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Hazelton Hotel a Luxurious 5 star oasis in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Triplethreatgr
Reviews.Content: The service is simply impeccable from the moment you enter to the moment you leave. Saying that the staff pays attention to every detail or request, is an understatement. There are no pretentious attitudes! What a blessing.The suites are extremely generous in space and the design is well appointed and the beds heavenly. If your're into a culinary experience, check out the restaurant ONE, the chef has some serious skills with his creations and will not disappoint. Personally I'm a fan of their spa, gym and pool. You feel like its your own private retreat. My last experience at the Hazelton I asked the manager if they could see if they can look into upgrading my floor tickets to the Prince concert. Well they arranged for me to sit in the VIP box with table service 15 feet away from from Prince and then to top it off i was one of 12 twelve people that got called up on stage to dance with him! Not bad for an "old man" at the club. Thanks to the Hazelton, my wife and I had another memorable time. And I'm just a regular guy.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE hotel to stay in Toronto!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Toronto and this is THE hotel to stay. The rooms are gorgeous and the service is impeccable. You're right in Yorkville which is where you want to be in Toronto. You cannot beat this location. The spa is also amazing!! The hotel restaurant ONE is one of the best restaurants in Toronto. Trust me, you want to stay at this hotel when you're in Toronto (if you can afford it).

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSpagirl
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Amazing service from start to finish. We upgraded to a suite room was beautiful and very modern. Loved the bathroom with the tv in the mirror. It was my husbands birthday and surprised us witha cake in the room. Really nice touch. Gym and pool were nice . I also loved the one restaurant had dinner and breakfast there both were great. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Brad D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hazelton Hotel. The hotel was terrific from the rooms to the restaurant. Probably what stood out most to us was the excellent service provided to us by Dean and Olivia. We will be staying there again on our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: tm123
Reviews.Content: Great staff and amazing hotel! As for a room with a nice view!

Reviews.Title: “Hazelton Hotel in Yorkville district”
Reviews.Author: FredvdFlier
Reviews.Content: On my trip I did in Toronto. Based on reviews and location I chose, knowing nothing of the city, The Hazelton Hotel in Yorkville district. First impression on arrival, nice modern hotel. Friendly doormen and receives the check. A very lively area, just such an excellent location. But again it was what a coincidence. On to the room and that was also determined not to. Had taken a Deluxe King Room. The hotel bar is a meeting place for many local and non local people, I feel. But a cozy bar. Outside, in good weather you can eat on the terrace. I think the ladies or gentleman to take your reservation and bring to the table, both at breakfast and dinner a bit on the arrogant side. Especially for hotel guests. I think that should have an edge on the people who like "seen" to be on the terrace. Anyway. Eating well is a little on the expensive, and only a la carte breakfast. The room is divine, I've never slept between sheets such as in this lovely hotel, really great class! Bed itself also delicious! TV fine, and the bathroom even once hell okay. Floor heating in winter, can not be better. Overall a very great comfort!. I also wanted a trip to Niagara Falls. And volunteered at the concierge, it was aided by Dean, super man. He gave you the feeling of what you will about the things you will do, with the appropriate tip, arranged car and other things for me. Really perfect and without arrogance. Upon returning sincerely ask how the region was. That's about as good as you do in the far abroad! In short it was a joy to be here. And not only here Toronto was more than fun, nice people, feel safe, and plenty to see and do. But alone on a bench to sit on the Hazelton hotel night and watch the world pass you see is pulling more than one attraction!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: teabag46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now, this hotel epitomizes what first class hotel should be. Amenities, room room service,attentive and unobtrusive staff, I cannot rate this Hotel highly enough. It is now officially my favorite hotel in the city of Toronto. We passed through the city this trip with a small dog, they took care of him as well. Location is excellent for what we like to do,and everything one could need is close by, loved it. just a note, not inexpensive for Canada, but compared to leading hotels certainly competitive, that's why I rated it high on the value scale.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel for a Special Occaisions”
Reviews.Author: crillon24
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Hazleton. If you are looking for a luxury hotel in Toronto you have found it. We love everything about this hotel. The location, the service, the food. Beds are supremely comfortable and the bathrooms are amazing. We haved stayed before and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Haute hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: This is the place to be if money is no object. Great location in Yorkville amidst high end shops and restaurants. If you don't know Yorkville be prepared for heavey traffic. Once you arrive you'll just want to park your car for the length of your stay. We booked a King suite which was quiet and luxurious and on the 5th floor. It was a corner room and reasonably large for the location, with a Juliet balcony and a view overlooking the busy street. We really enjoyed being able to open the balcony doors and watch the passer bys. We had drinks and hor'dearves in the quiet, trendy, expensive bar. We did not have dinner in the hotel restaurant "One" as we normally prefer to dine offsight. We did have breakfast there on Sunday morning. The breakfast was great, the service was fine, and the dining room was beautiful. We had a table by the windows with a nice view of the street - although on Sunday morning there are not many shoppers going by. The fitness room was well equipped and not crowded when we used it Sunday morning. They also had a spa which we did't use.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in trendy Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: Very chic & trendy boutique hotel in center of Yorkville Traveled here with a few colleagues during Toronto Film Festival ... Good for people watching, but crowds everywhere. My first choice would have been a large 5star hotel, preferably the one around the corner, but they were all booked and we were lucky to get rooms here. Check-in took a while as the clerk was in training (I assume) She was quite chipper and friendly, which is a nice after a fairly uncomfortable flight and awful weather. The room I booked wasn't a standard as there were none left - so it was huge. Large dressing area with mirrors and closet space, but I wish the lighting could have been better. Huge bathroom with tub and separate stand shower. Good lighting in here and lit makeup mirror too. Plenty of soft towels and great smelling toiletries. Here are the negatives ... My colleagues were mostly also pleased with their rooms as well but we all had the same complaints of too much outside noise. I dont know if the windows are thin or if everyone was feeling extra festive because of TIFF, but being awoken by loud house music and people yelling at 3am arent how I want to spend the wee hours of a Tuesday. The elevators require you to swipe your keycard in order to use them. Good safety measure. But this was a bit of a hassle considering me and my colleagues were placed on different floors. So instead we had to use the staircase instead... Kind of defeats the safety measure of making the elevators accessible only by keycard if you can just use the stairs. We tried to stop in the restaurant for a late drink and maybe dessert. When we asked the hostess if they had space for us, she simply said no, without even looking at us. Not even asking if we wanted to wait, or if we wanted to put our names down ... Nothing. I said aloud "well, that's a shame" and she glared at me. What a sweetheart. All in all this is a very nice boutique hotel but the elevator/staircase safety measures confuse me and the restaurant hostess needs a bit of an attitude adjustment - maybe from the front desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gin74italy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at The Hazelton, and it was a great experience. Wonderful rooms, amazing and huge bathroom, trendy but elegant... The staff is very kind and professional, and the hotel has all the amenities you can wish. The ONE Restaurant is excellent, we are from Italy and there we eated unforgettable "linguine carbonara". The bar too is very nice, and it's very popular also among the locals. The Concierge staff is absolutely fantastic, specially Mr. Voon, that will transform all your wishes into reality. We travel a lot, and for sure The Hazelton is one of the best hotel we have ever seen. Strongly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “great service!”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hazelton and loved our stay. The front desk staff had trouble locating our reservation but they quickly got us checked in. The staff was very courteous and the room very clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fun respite”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: Hazelton is quite the contemporary hang-out. Perfectly situated in a great location. Room decor is tasteful; dark wood, black marble, glass, mirrors, etc. Tons of space. We camped out in the enormous bathroom as it had heated floors, tv, luxurious tub, etc. Our room faced Yorkville Street which was pleasant during the day, as we kept our French doors open and enjoyed the foot traffic and fresh air but once the evening lounge crowd arrived we closed our doors...too much noise and cigarette smoke, yuck! There's a convenient work station on each floor with computer and printer...very handy! We loved the restaurant, nice decor, delicious food and great service. The spa is itty bitty and really no where to lounge. Had a mani, pedi...outrageously priced....never ever paid so much in my life !!! We worked out at the gym which was clean and well stocked with towels, fruit and water. Overall, nice place, welcoming staff and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: adipati
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel and it's an awesome place. Funky yet functional. Elegant without it being over the top. I like their "mini-bar" concept - a fridge one can actually put one own drinks in. They provide water and soft drinks, which are free, and some liquor. Tea and coffee are also free with a separate kettle for tea drinkers/makers, so no coffee taste in your tea. Their restaurant and room service is a culinary delight. And their location is fantastic. So close to many stores, other restaurants, musea, movie theatres. Love this hotel and I'll be back again in October.

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel in its class!”
Reviews.Author: BryanKelly1973
Reviews.Content: I should begin by saying that my career has placed me in many upscale hotels within Toronto. Four Seasons, Fairmont, Pantages, Ritz Carlton, Windsor Arms (just to name a few) however the Hazelton Hotel is by far the best in its class! My wife and I checked in on Sunday July 17, 2011 and I can say with all certainty that it was the best experience either of us had ever had in a hotel. From the moment we pulled up to the Valet to the moment of our departure we had nothing but positive comments. The lad working Valet was very pleasant and professional. I was insistent on carrying my own luggage however every staff member we came across offered to handle it for me. At check in we were greeted by "Niki" who was extremely friendly and helpful pointing out all of the amenities that the hotel had to offer as well as providing my pregnant wife with a cool bottle of water and assisting us to the elevators. We were situated in suite 409 (a lovely room which we will request again next time). The room was very well spaced with a great dressing area as well as a spacious office area. The room was elaborate and had the feeling of "grandeur". Both my wife and I simply fell in love with the bathroom. The soaker tub was exquisite and came in very handy when my wife wanted a moment to relax. The linens in the room, were as my wife put it "like sleeping on a cloud". The bed itself was a dream and very relaxing, so much so that we both slept in the following morning. During our stay my wife called front desk and requested the use of an iron. The iron and board were brought up within minute and were set up for our use, again the staff that brought up the items was very friendly and pleasant. In the evening we decided to dine at One Restaurant being that my wife had never been before. Again, the staff greeting us as the entrance were very friendly and helpful. Our waitress was very professional and assisted with all our inquiries. The food was much like everything else, exquisite! We checked out the following day and it was smooth sailing. When our vehicle was brought up they Valet placed two bottles of water in it, which was a lovely touch to an already amazing experience. The only unfortunate thing is that we couldn't stay longer! However, we will definitely be coming back and staying a couple days on our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryR60
Reviews.Content: As someone who has travelled much of the world staying in 5 star hotels this one rates as one of the very best. Service was unobtrusive but always available. Help was accurate and knowledgeable and coevered every member of staff we cam into contact with. The bedroom was well equipped and comfortable and and shoud we have found anything missing we are quite sure every attempt would have been made to provide it. A home from home and a return visit to Toronto would be a return visit to the Hazelton.

Reviews.Title: “Could use better bathrobes and towels”
Reviews.Author: timaccen
Reviews.Content: I travel the world on business, and the first thing I look for is an exceptionally comfortable bed, a beautiful bathroom, and wonderful service. The Hazelton Hotel is exceptional in most instances. But seriously, for a hotel of that caliber and price range, one would expect the most plush bathrobes and towels. Mostly everywhere I go, I seem to encounter FRETTE bathrobes and towels. Talk about luxury!!! I am so spoilt that I need FRETTE at home now. But at The Hazelton, where exactly do they get their bathrobes and towels from? Really - they could use FRETTE. Wake up management - think of the little details.

Reviews.Title: “The Hazleton earns each of its five stars!”
Reviews.Author: DLO1975
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern and comfortable with all the amenities you'd expect out of a five star hotel. The balconies are surprisingly large and well furnished. Don't shy away from a balcony overlooking busy Yorkville Avenue, as the soundproofing is incredible. The bathroom was really unique. Wall to wall granite, a heated floor, a large tv built into the mirror with an in ceiling speaker, a huge soaking tub, and a rainfall shower head extending from the ceiling. The complimentary mini bar and wireless internet were great bonuses. The service was exceptional. The staff addressed us by name everywhere we went and Dean, the concierge, definitely went the extra mile. The hotel restaurant, ONE, is excellent. The food and service were outstanding and the patio is definitely the place to be in Toronto. We reserved under a buy two get one free special, which helped bring the price down a bit...but the Hazelton was truly worth every penny and the Yorkville area with its upscale shops and outdoor dining is a great location to stay! The Hazelton is a true five star experience and is favored by many celebrities (Lady Gaga was there during our visit).

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyny4me
Reviews.Content: In all regards our stay at the elegant Hazelton Hotel was outstanding. The dÃ©cor is stunning with a cosmopolitan flair. Our room was beautiful, extremely spacious and had the most comfortable bed we have ever experienced. I could spend hours in the gorgeous, expansive bathroom. We had a lovely view of Yorkville Avenue through glass doors opening to the street. These doors were of such high quality that we could close them and totally damp out the buzz of the city when we tired of being a part of the sounds of this fabulous neighborhood. In fact, this is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. I took advantage of the lovely spa and pool and was impressed with the beauty of the facilities. What also sets the Hazelton Hotel apart from other upscale hotels is the staff. Every staff member we encountered was genuinely friendly, professional and went that â€œextra mileâ€� at every turn. For example, I lost a very small part of an earring in our room. I was sure it would be vacuumed up, as the room was impeccably clean. Much to my surprise, housekeeping found the earring part and left in a conspicuous place so I could find it. Original and unique art throughout the hotel, choices of cream content for the coffee in our room, control of all lights and drapes by the bed side are just a few examples of how no detail is overlooked. The Hazelton Hotel sets the gold standard for luxury. We look forward to out next stay at the world-class Hazelton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel! Best staff!”
Reviews.Author: MissLarry
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Canada and my husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. I can't go on enough about how amazing the staff was. Every single person was friendly and helpful and we felt so welcome and pampered. Special props to Helene for the BEST spa body treatment I've ever had. Do make a visit to the Spa if you can! The room was gorgeous! We loved the large dressing area and separate closets. The bathroom was a dream and quite large. The shower had awesome water pressure, which you might think is unimportant - until you've stayed somewhere it's terrible!! The bed was super soft and comfortable. The food is very expensive, but then again Toronto is an expensive city. Walk across the street to Starbuck's if you don't want to pay for a pricy breakfast. Expensive food aside, I'd say this was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in - and we travel a lot! I wouldn't stay enywhere else in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RIcca75
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Hazelton for our wedding anniversary and it was amazing.Located in by far the best neighborhood in Toronto, with lots of restaurants, boutiques and bars just minutes away. Concierge staff is very friendly, professional and courteous. Attention to details and design is outstanding throughout the hotel, the room was needless to say gorgeous, with lots of space and a beautiful black marble bathroom (the HDTV embedded in the mirror is the best!!). Don't forget to go and try The Spa and fitness area, it's worth it. Great stay will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “5-Star luxury in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: renaissancewoman99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great oasis for my husband and I to spend a luxurious weekend in. It had all the comforts of home and then some. The suite was finished beautifully, from the marble floors, the high thread count sheets, the large flat-screen tv, to the oversized soaker tub. The staff were attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: VT2369
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 weeks, very happy with the service and the location, but did not get good night sleep. First weekend, there was some kind of party going on, and people in and out in the hallway, sound proof is poor in such 5 star hotel, so I called the operation and complained, it was dealt with right away, but it happend again the following night. Then there was garbage truch came 5 days a week, early in the morning, in the alley way facing my room. In 2 weeks time, I only got no more than 3 nights good sleep. Not sure I want to go back next time...

Reviews.Title: “It was Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: adamo155004
Reviews.Content: 4 months ago i had a idea to propose to my better half and it involved a screening room. Seeing that The Hazelton in Toronto on Yorkville had a screening room for rent I had made a phone call and was connected with Amy, one of there staff members. I cant thank Amy enough for helping me and putting everything in order and that whole weekend went off without a bump.. The staff at the Hazelton went above the call of customer service they made the whole weekend Fantastic and the service at the Hazelton was Outstanding.. I cant thank Amy enough for all her help and the staff at the Hazelton Thank you. You all made my weekend a memorable one .

Reviews.Title: “The Hazelton Hotel is Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Fortunate-Life
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Toronto for over 10 years now for leisure. I have stayed at all the 5 star hotels and boutique hotels available. Hands down Hazelton Hotel is the BEST hotel in Toronto, no doubt. From the minute you walk in you are greeted by door men that are friendly and eager to help you with your bags, get a taxi for you or simply open the door. These true gentleman are some of the best representatives of the hotel, because they are reflection of what your about to experience. Once you walk in you see this flawless hotel, with its gorgeous lobby, perfect appointed furniture and fresh cut flowers. It has stunning marble and carpet flooring. Every detail has been thought about when it comes to this hotel. Staff members are exceptional, always eager to help you out with whatever you need. They are always polite and friendly. When you check in you are greeted at the front desk with a smile. Check in is always hassle free. Usually upon my arrival I am usually early when checking in, but no worries. Because the hotel usually has a room ready. The rooms are divine. From lush carpeting through out the room, to heated marble flooring for the bathroom. They have thought of everything when it comes to there hotel rooms. The rooms are fitted throughout with tech friendly devices for lighting and remote control curtains. The bed is so inviting with down pillows and extra comfortable mattress. The food is exceptional, the hotel is connected to Mark McEwan's restaurant called "ONE" The food that comes out of that kitchen is mouth watering. The room service for the hotel also comes from the same restaurant. I have eaten there several times whether it be for breakfast, lunch, dinner or drinks. I have never been disappointed. Room service is always punctual and the food is always on point. The facilities at the Hazelton Hotel are one of the best I have ever used in Toronto. The swimming pool and the Gym are equal to or if not better than some Luxury Gyms in the city. There are three Staff members that go out an beyond to make sure my stay is always taken care of. Olivia Tran - Front Manager Dean Voon - Concierge, Apprentice Member - Ontario, Les Clefs d'Or Canada Myra Engalla - Fron Desk Reception These three exceptional staff members are always willing to make sure that all my needs are taken care of. Whenever I stay there, room always has a welcome fruit basket and hand written notes welcoming me to the Hazelton Hotel. I honestly feel like I am at home when I stay at the Hazelton. There is not one bad thing I can say about any of my numerous stays. It is truly a privilege to have such a wonderful hotel in Toronto. Once you stay there, you will never want to stay at another hotel in Toronto. I promise you that.

Reviews.Title: “The Hazelton is now my Hotel when staying in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Pear155004
Reviews.Content: Very professional, friendly ,and discrete. Dining at One was quite an experience. There was no need to leave the Hotel for food.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best Hotel in Toronto !”
Reviews.Author: KeepTravelling057
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a suite (May 27th-29) at The Hazelton hotel and it was amazing. This hotel was well designed and thoroughly thought through (touch button control for lights and drapes, heated floors, TV in the bathroom, huge bathtub and multi jet glass shower). Everything is geared towards making the guestâ€™s experience memorable. Itâ€™s the first 5 start hotel weâ€™ve stayed at that offers a complimentary mini bar! The staff is extremely professional, courteous and accomodating. The spa was very nice. It featured a steam shower, multi jet shower and a magnificent heated pool. All amenities were provided. We loved our stay and highly recommend that you try it. It doesn't compare to any other hotel and is a must to add on your to do list!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In The City”
Reviews.Author: Kokiri1976
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Toronto on business and pleasure for years. I travel so much that I want to take some pride in my accommodations. I have stayed in the nicest hotels in Toronto and a friend suggested I try The Hazelton (Theee Hazelton)... So I did. From check-in to check-out the service is top of the top. The boutique hotel meant I did not feel like cattle being herded while also creating an enviable staff to guest ratio. The room was fantastic - I had a private balcony and the location is the best in the city. I now know why celebs like Bono stay at the Hazelton... IT IS THEE BEST Hotel in the City. Bar none. Period. The best part - is the price - on par or better than some comparable hotels which claim to be comparable... BTW - these claims are false. I recommend the Hazelton highly and will be staying there on my next trip. You should, too. You will thank me.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a minute!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BizBag
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel...It really has it all....First of all, the area it is in (Bloor-Yorkville) has to be the most quaint, charming (and expensive!) in Toronto...All the shops and side streets give it that Newbury Street in Boston feel to it, and we spent days wandering back and forth, eating and drinking our way around ( a must is the MoRoCo chocolate bar nearby...damn adorable) and high end shopping is just a few streets over...We stayed in a Deluxe King, with the window opening out onto Yorkville, overlooking the diners below at Ciao (separate review!!!). The heated floors work well and the room was spacious, and the bed incredible. The deep tub was perfect for two..Very modern and the closet area huge with his and her sides...The touch button controls for the drapes are a nice touch as well! There are all age groups here but the real fun is hitting the bar and the outside patio, watching the people and the cars stroll by. Drinks are horribly expensive ($18 martini's! ouch)..but for the smoke inclined, there is a huge outdoor cigar area and it was filled every night, and a blast to sit, drink, enjoy a good cuban (available from the bar humidor or even better...across the street at La Casa del Habano!!!) The breakfast was great, either in room or down at the restaurant, again, outdoors...And on the weekends, the bar was hopping... Staff was fabulous on all counts. The spa was a little weak as they only had one therapist working, but she was very good. On our last day we rented a car from a few blocks over, and drove to Niagara Falls, visited a winery and wandered through the incredibly picture perfect quaint town of Niagara on the Lake, stuck the car in the parking structure right across the street from the Hazelton ($17/day vs $38/ day at the Hotel...OK..one minus..and even though I am willing to pay top dollar for this hotel... I still cant pass up a savings when it is taunting me from my hotel room window!!!!), and used it to drive us to the airport the next morning and dropped it there! Worked perfect. It was an expensive weekend...and I cant wait to go back. I would not hesitate to recommend this great hotel, on a great street, in a great section of town, in a great city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated,Overpriced, Over hyped”
Reviews.Author: stregisbabe
Reviews.Content: Thought we would try this hotel. our room overlooked a dirty back alley and noisy parking garage. This hotel only has serveal/four floors -- so whatever you do, stay away from the side that faces the back sleezy alley. The room is large but there was not enough airconditionnig to keep the room comfortable. So we had to prop our window doord opne -- which was problematic because it opens -- yeas you guessed it - to the back alley and noisy parking garage. The front desk person that checked us in came across as a snob. A very unfriendly service staff except for the cocierge. The bar at the hotel appears upsacle -- but we could not get anyone's attention for a second glass of wine. It was sort of silly -- there were three staff members at the bar all talking -- for about 15 mins -- and we couldn't get anyone's attention. Even though the bar was fairly empty. Room service is a joke -- waited 45 mins for breakfast -- and we turned it away since it was getting so late. just charging 5 star hotel rates doesn't make you a five star hotel. If you are going to tornto - stay away from this rip-off. try the Royal York or the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend staycation”
Reviews.Author: Oldman007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to a weekend away from the kids and didnt want to go too far and we opted to stay at The Hazelton Hotel. From the moment we walked in we were greeted by exceptionally friendly staff who were egar to please - we were given a $50.00 gift certificate to the spa as welcome note from the general manager (a nice touch considering we spent over 500 dollars on the room) though we didnt have time to go the spa - the resturant is a must try for breakfast. The pancakes just melt in your mouth and the overpriced $10 smoothie was worth every penny. I did not hear one complaint out of my partners mouth all weekend, and she is one hard one to please. We cannot wait to return, perhaps this time we will have more time to give the spa a try

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Hazelton Shake-Down”
Reviews.Content: So I decide to evaluate the Hazelton Hotel for our consultancy firm. I make a reservation and secure a deluxe room at a rate of $495. I am advised this is an excellent room. When I check-in, the front desk clerk ( aka da witch) suggests that for $50 more she can put me in a nicer room. That strikes me as odd. I mean this is suppose to be a great hotel and I was told by the reservationist that I resereved a great room for $498. Well i go to my room escorted by a bell-hop. The room looks over a dark and dirty back alley and a parking garage. The bell-hop calls the front desk and asks that I be placed in a better located room - the bell -hop indicates that the hotel is "wide open" (low occupancy). But Da Witch indicates that no $50 bucks, no better room! I suggest they rethink things in that I am attempting to decide on Toronto hotels for our consultants to stay while on engagements. Da Witch just doesn't get it. So for $500 bucks I get a lousy room overlooking a dirty back alley and parking garage. But it doesn't end with that. The room is actually quite roomy, very contemporary. But it turns out that the airconditioning is vented into the room through one very small grilled opening. I mean tiny. So of course no air conditioning is flowing to speak of in the room -- and certainly not toward the bathroom/showere area located in the back of the room. So I sweat my xxxx off all night. The morning is worse -- I cannot stop sweating from my shower. I stand up on a chair in front of the tiny airconditioning vent. Meanwhile late my first night the manager on duty calls my room and indicates that they would like to move me to a better room. The one that da Witch was attempting to shake me down for an additiuonal $50. But of course I am un packed and running to a business dinner with a client. Then there was the breakfast I ordered through room service. Told it would be in my room in 20 mins -- after 45 mins - no food, so I cancel the breakfast -- as I need to get to work (this after calling room service 4 times to locate the MIA breakfast). Needless to say the Hazelton will not be getting any business from my organization -- and of course I am using the Hazelton experience in my speeches on bad customer service. A better bet -- stay at the four seasons just across the street -- and down the block and around the corner the new four season's is being built -- and it looks fantastic. Take a pass on the hazelton shake-down!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Human size Deluxe Hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Content: A very nice and luxurious hotel, the rooms and bathrooms are very large, and the service exceptional, the concierge were generous and so kind, they did send the post I had for free. The central location is ideal. The trendy restaurant next door seems to be the "Place" to be in Toronto. Nevertheless the room service is very quick, 15 minutes to be served. The breakfasts are very generous. The mini bar are free (non alcoholic beverage) I especially liked the bathroom even if I do regret that no slippers are available.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MarakiOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hazelton with 2 children and were surprised with the options they provided us: 2 connecting rooms or suite - we opted for the suite and the kids were thrilled as were we as we had our privacy. The service was fantastic from the moment we walked in the door. The location is perfect as you are right in Yorkville and a 5 min walk from Bloor St and all the great shopping it provided. The spa in the hotel was extremely professional and the gym is well appointed for its' size. The restaurant "One" is one of my favourite spots in Toronto which makes its so convenient as it is just an elevator ride down! I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a luxurious stay in T.O....

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best”
Reviews.Author: danpb
Reviews.Content: They announce it at the citysightseeing tours as the most expensive hotel in Toronto. It's worth every single $. Don't leave without trying the Eggs Benedict for breakfast at the restaurant, mouthwatering. Perfect stay

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer!”
Reviews.Author: jokitalo
Reviews.Content: Every detail was seen to. The ambiance was classy and tasteful. Service was excellent and the staff courteous. I will look froward to booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BuzzCane
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a meeting and stayed at the Hazelton Hotel. I might as well stay at Hotels for a living, as I travel frequently. Everything from stem to post with this hotel is done with extreme precision and no detail is overlooked. The rooms are very spacious, for a downtown hotel and have top of the line amenities. The staff were over-the-top with their service and knowledge. I wont stay anywhere else in Toronto. It's pricier than others, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: vpoleshuck
Reviews.Content: This is just what a great hotel should be--outstanding rooms, luxurious appointments, excellent service, and all done quietly and in an understated way. Excellent concierge service bolstered the impeccable courtesy and friendliness of all the staff. There was no stuffiness. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow! Very luxurious and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: HollisJD
Reviews.Content: Probably the finest hotel in which I've ever stayed. The hotel is not over-the-top glamorous or extravagant, but there is a quiet luxury that creates a level of refinement I've never experienced at another facility. The service is impeccable. Whenever I called for something to be brought up or picked up from the room, they were there immediately. The electronic door signs made it very easy for housekeeping to know when the room was occupied and when it was ready for cleaning. The room service was superb. The attention to detail and cleanliness was outstanding. Turn-down service every night was equivalent to another room cleaning for the evening. The room was quiet, dark and so very comfortable for sleep. The bathroom has walls of granite slabs. And the coffee maker for specialized, individualized coffee was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury, not stuffy; Excellent for corporate and leisure; Authentic personalized service.”
Reviews.Author: CrystalGM
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at The Hazelton. Purpose of the trip was combined business and leisure. The location is ideal in the heart of Yorkville, downtown Toronto, direct access to business district, steps from signature shopping yet insulated from inner-city clutter. The Hazelton felt like a blend of corporate and residential style, excellent innovative finishes, dramatic room decor, high technology business functionality while ensuring personalized authentic service. Rooms are very well laid out and spacious, super comfortable beds, room controls at arm's length. Really liked the fact each floor had its own fully equipped compact business center. Great pool and fitness facility. Effective elevator security card access ensures only guests have access. Excellent Food & Beverage on site with vast wine list and diverse menu. Great stay, will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Always an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan D
Reviews.Content: Don't bother looking any further! Pay the extra dollars and experience the nicest hotel in Canada! The restaurant and bar are absolutely amazing any time of the year and the food is fantastic. The rooms are spotless and have everything you could want or need. I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bargain but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Mike699
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in November. We did not use the Spa but did use the workout area. The good: The service at the Hazelton was superb. The location is prime in Yorkville. Easy walking to shops and restaurants. The concierge was extremely helpful. He recommended fantastic restaurants , made reservations and sent typed agendas to our room. The rooms are very well appointed. The bathroom is fantastic. The mini bar is stocked with free water and soda. Choice of purchased wine and other alcohol at your discretion. Workout area is adequate but small. There is an indoor pool. The bad: Expensive but you get what you pay for so I had mixed feelings about putting this as a negative. I would stay there again but hesitate unless there was a 'free' night offer or some other insentive. The room has no snacks food. Not bad for all but if you're looking for a mini bar with a candy bar, can of nuts or something to tide you over, nothing offered in the room

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic introduction to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: If you're in Toronto - stay here. No need to write much more than that! 5* in every sense. Great food, great staff, amazing beds, amazing bathrooms, superb location. What more needs saying?

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt be any better”
Reviews.Author: steve-golfguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided on the Hazelton to celebrate our anniversary and knew that we would be arriving early and asked for an early check in if possible and also for a room on the fourth floor . Upon arriving early as we walked upto the front desk the attendant greeted us by name and told us we could check in right away and our room request was granted The staff could not have been more accomodating during our stay In additon the room was not only well furnisined and tastefully down but the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable ( did i mention you can choose your pillow type ) and to our suprise the room was also quiet . They also have an excellant spa and a great indoor pool ---We will back again next year

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: 255103linda
Reviews.Content: Wow, right from the start staff were exceptional and so friendly. Rooms were beautiful especially the bathroom, utter luxury, even a small tv in the mirror!!! The location was excellent, hotel in the middle of a very trendy street, lots of shops and restaurants, what a street!! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would go back to this hotel in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: janettraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hazelton is the best hotel I have ever stayed in by far. The location: best of Toronto at your doorstep. The staff: courteous, and helpful and not at all contrived about it. The rooms are elegant and glamorous and the bed, comfy. I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone I meet who has need for luxury accommodation in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Serene”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: As far as I'm concerned, at this point in time, The Hazelton is the best hotel in Toronto. The Yorkville location can't be beat. The room was a nice size, the bathroom was well appointed with heated floors, a soaking tub, separate shower with rainshower head and a television for those who like to catch up on the news or a TV show while bathing, etc. In addition, everything was clean and, overall, the hotel is well maintained. Moreover, I didn't hear any noise whatsoever from other guests or the hotel staff while I was nestled away in my room. It was great. The hotel is nicely designed in sort of a transitional style; not too contemporary, not too traditional. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was an oversized chair in the room that's perfect for lounging or reading a book. Non alcoholic beverages are included in the room rate, although they hit you with an additional fee of about $10 for something or other. If I recall correctly, the explanation given to me was that it covers the cost of the business center -- regardless of whether or not you use it. Kind of goofy and petty in my opinion, but that's how they roll. All and all, I had an enjoyable stay and I suspect I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: fredeashby
Reviews.Content: Excellent and interesting location, well appointed with the unusual addition of some fascinating artwork. Easy access to public transport and within walking distance of the ROM. We had a friendly welcome and found all staff in every area charming and extremely helpful. The rooms were comfortable with a restful atmosphere - we loved the pillow menu! The beds were difficult to leave in the morning as they were so comfortable. We enjoyed some good shopping in the area and found some charming little restaurants locally. Thank you for a wonderful time - we'll be back. Frederika Ashby, Daphne Barkworth and Nicola Crundwell (13.08.10 to 17.08.10)

Reviews.Title: “Best in the city...until the new Four Seasons is ready down the street.”
Reviews.Author: RLA
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Toronto and you have a very flexible budget, I highly recommend staying in the "Bloor / Yorkville" area of downtown, which has all the high-end shopping and wonderful restaurants and bars. The Hazelton Hotel is in the middle of Yorkville --- it's just a couple years old; five star, very glamorous/modern decor, top notch service and my personal favorite restaurant in Toronto, "One" (a Mark McEwan restaurant) -- amazing for a fabulous dinner and/or just cocktails or even breakfast. Other than the darker-than-prefered lighting throughout the hallways, this is a gorgeous hotel that won't disappoint. NB: If you're looking to spa, I'm sure the Hazelton Spa downstairs is perfectly adequate (we didn't try it) -- we much prefer the Stillwater Spa right across the street at the Park Hyatt -- the best city hotel spa I've been to. NB2: Look for the new Four Seasons to open later this year (very close to the Hazelton Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A truly exceptional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: northerndecorator
Reviews.Content: The Hazelton Hotel in Toronto is a fabulous hotel in every way . If you are coming to Toronto for business or pleasure and you are looking for a higher end hotel, I highly recommend The Hazelton. The hotel is also a perfect choice for a special occasion. There are so many reasons The Hazelton Hotel is so special. Just to name a few.....starting with the location which just couldn't be better. The Hazelton is situated in a gorgeous area in the heart of Yorkville, surrounded by lovely scenery, boutiques, cafes, and restaurants...everything is literally right at your fingertips. The hotel itself is very glamorous with a stunning lobby, an inviting sitting area and large hallways leading to the guest rooms. After you check in a valet demonstrates how to use your room key to gain access to the elevator (which is a great idea for added security). Then the valet escorts you (and of course your luggage) to your suite. The suite entrance is huge, with his and hers closets, shelves for your suitcases, and two counter areas. There is also a little fridge in this same area stocked with complimentary water and soda. I have never seen such a large amount of space for storage in any hotel... and it really is appreciated. The powder room is exceptionally beautiful. There is granite everywhere you look, basically from floor to ceiling. The bathtub is gynormous, I have never, ever seen such a huge bathtub in my entire life. There is a beautiful glass rainfall shower with powerful water pressure, which is so rare in hotels these days. The heated floors, bathrobes and slippers, weigh scale, and pull out make up mirror, are a few more extras. My favorite thing of all in the powder room... is the tv screen that is built right into the mirror. It's difficult to leave this room, it is just so wonderful! Another thing I really like are the towels. There are at least 4 large towels, two of which are gigantic towel sheets. It is a nice touch when you are staying in a hotel to have the option of extra towels, without having to ask for them. The powder room is also stocked with lovely L'Occittane bath and body products. The main suite is decorated with a hint of the 1940's theme, which makes it have that glamorous feel to it. The drapes are very high quality, and open and close with a push of a button. The large flat screen tv pulls out from the wall, and the lovely desk and leather chair is great for your computer and other incidentals. There is more storage for your belongings in this main area of the suite as well. The room is a very nice size and the reading area with it's cozy chair and floor lamp adds to the overall ambience of the space. Then of course there is the bed, which has high end Italian linens and great pillows. The entire hotel is spotless and extremely well kept and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant and 24 hour room service are just a few of the many other reasons this hotel stands out. The hotel really is a 'luxury' hotel in every sense of the word. Thank you for reading this review!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star It Is Not! Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: HippyChic101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights of my two-month Toronto vacation. Was going to make it a 3rd but service experience was poor so I decided it was best go elsewhere. Staff seem to be mainly European and provide heavily accented European customer service in a North American context. Think Seinfeld's "Soup Nazi". One highlight was concierge staff member (gorgeous Canadian man of East Asian heritage whose name I do not recall) who provided professional, prompt, and accurate assistance. Room was nice and had a decent view. Restaurant food was fine. Liked most of items ordered. Service was poor. The regular room service person was rather pushy, rude, and presumptuous. He was the reason I left the hotel early. For the price and self promotion, I was disappointed. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Hazelton Hotel -- Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Movin4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from a weekend stay at the Hazelton Hotel. We checked in on Friday and out today. Overall, we'd say it was a mixed bag. We had a Luxury King Room which was well appointed and very comfortable with complimentary water/soft drinks..but if you wanted an extra L'Occitaine bath product it was $6...huh? The swivel flat screen was nice for the sofa and bed. Our room was on the second floor over the street which was a bit noisy throughout the night. The bathroom was large and really well thought out. Spa/Healthclub: So so -- the workout room was small and with no windows it felt very closed in. We were there at 7am on Saturday morning and there were about 5 other people and it seemed crowded. Spa services were ok. My pedicure was in a facial room with a bowl of water. Not particularly comfortable..in fact it was uncomfortable in some cases when the technician was working due to how you had to sit to position your feet. If they had told me that ahead of time, I would have passed on the pedicure. The line of polish they use is very dated in terms of color choices. For $100+ you'd expect current color selections. The technician was so so. The reception area was not particularly friendly or welcoming. I'd say there's better places to spend your time/money. Services: Housekeeping was very detailed and our room was very clean. Extra pillows from the pillow menu was nice and delivered quickly. Shoe shine and garmet pressing were both executed with speed and good quality. They say that they have "free internet" but you actually pay a $9.95 daily "facility" fee. Again, this should be transparent when making the reservation. Restaurant: very uneven... we had breakfast included. The server was a bit cold on the first day. This morning, the server was very friendly and accomodating. Late Saturday afternoon we wanted to have a cocktail on the patio and there were plenty of open tables. The "outside" hostess could not be bothered with us and told us there were no tables available. The "inside" hostess saw us sitting inside and, very kindly, followed up to get us a table outside. She told us we had to clear the table by 5:40 pm. Given that was 55 minutes later, it was not a problem to agree too. We spent $85 on 4 drinks... and watched the hostess turn table and table away. It must be nice to have the option to turn away business in a restaurant. I'm sure if they specified to a number of the people that came up the time they needed the tables, that they would have agreed to leave by then. Most were looking for a drink outside since it was a beautiful day. Valet Staff -- they opened the doors for you but you had to hail your own cab. Very odd for a hotel that's trying to be luxury hotel. Overall, I wanted to like this hotel more than I did. Nothing was particularly wrong with the exception of the spotty restaurant service at times. We enjoyed out get away and the experience but there were aspects that definitely could have been better especially given the price point.

Reviews.Title: “Best and worst of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: FreqBusTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent Memorial Day weekend with my partner in Toronto and was really excited about staying at The Hazelton. The location was fantastic - right on the ritzy Yorkville Avenue with many great restaurants within walking distance. Our first impression was the doormen greeting us by name - they were expecting us which was a nice touch. Check-in was uneventful. Our room was impressive - very well designed, spacious with a large luxurious bathroom with copious amounts of wardrobe space. We loved the free Nespresso coffee machine, selection of tea and complimentary soft drinks in the room. My only complaint about the room was it felt sterile and lacking character. The rest of the hotel felt the same way - it was dark, there didn't appear to be any other guests staying there for the first couple of days, and in a weird kind of way, it all felt a little lonely. Our experience at the restaurant was less impressive. The breakfast was average - the food didn't appear to be fresh, and the service was sloppy and inconsistent. We were often left waiting for silly things like salt and pepper, napkins and spoons while our food got cold. Or side dishes would consistently be forgotten every day during breakfast service. The staff appeared not to care less, and there was never a manager anywhere in sight. Our experience at The Spa was mixed - my partner loved his 60 massage, but I had the unfortunate experience of a masseur who had just been out the back for a smoke and had the lingering stench of cigarettes on her breath - not a nice touch when you're paying $130 for a massage. My biggest gripe with the hotel was the addition of almost $100 worth of taxes per night on top of the $500 I was already paying, which included a mysterious $15 "facility tax" which I was told for "complimentary internet". Next time I'm in Toronto, I would probably consider The Four Seasons once the renovations are complete. Overall, The Hazelton felt like a good 4 start hotel trying hard to be a 5 star hotel but not quite cutting it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PHCDK
Reviews.Content: Read my other review about the Soho, this hotel has very similar rooms, better location for a weekend getaway, but lacks the excellent and personal service of the Soho. However, I would me more than happy to return to the Hazelton if the price is equal to the Soho. I prefer the atmosphere at the Soho which is a bit more laid back and not as "showy". But Hazelton for sure have the better scene on Saturday evenings and restaurant is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “real 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hazleton for my birthday this hotel has to the best hotel in Toronto if not in Canada I lived in Vancouver for 20 years and stayed at almost all the hotels there nothing comes close the hazleton is truly top of its class. amazing rooms bath rooms are spectacular. Richard Branson was staying there at the same time as me if this hotel is good enough for a billionaire its defiantly good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: DocRobert2000
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. The service is first class as well as everything else. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are amazing. It's quiet and peaceful, yet there's plenty of activity in the bar/restaurant area. If you enjoy 5 star hotels, this one is definitely worth spending some time at.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Best hotel I've been in!”
Reviews.Author: NeedsAVacationPlease
Reviews.Content: On May 27th, 2010 I went to Toronto with my dad for bonding (I'm 16), and we decided to stay in the Hazelton Hotel. I did my usual research with trip advisor before we booked it, and saw that a lot of the reviews were positive. I was very optimistic. We got to the hotel at 11pm. It was a bit difficult to find our way to the hotel (we rented a car), but luckily we had google maps! The street that the hotel is on was packed! There was music from every direction, people walking contantly. Seems like quite the party attraction. Once we got to the front of the hotel, it was a bit more confusing; There was a sign that said "VALLET PARKING", however there was no place to park in order for the vallet to serve. We had to go around the block two times, until we just decided to pull into what looked like a parking section beside the hotel - little did we know that this zone was actually the hotel vallet parking, NOT the sign. The sign was for the restaurants around the hotel. Oops! Once we got into the hotel, I was amazed at the decorating. It looked amazing! The service at the front desk was good, nothing wrong about it. A man guided us through the elevator (the key was needed for extra security), and then guided us thorugh our room (which was beautiful). Oddly enough, what caught our attention was that no one offered to take our bags. We didn't need the help, however so that wasn't a problem. Our room was room 202 (If I remember correctly) The room (pictures included) was fantastic. There was a large closet, with marble and wooden walls, with no shortage of mirrors. Many places to hang clothes, if needed. Through the closet was the bathroom, with the tallest doors I've seen. Again, the bathroom was completely marble (or granet, I'm not sure which). There was a soaker tub (I didn't use, but there was a detachable head that leaked), and a rain-head shower (again with a second detachable head) that was wonderful. There was a small television built right into the mirror! The lights were controlled by one panel on the wall, as well as heated floors! The bedroom had wonderful beds, and a large TV. There was also a small sitting area with two large chairs and a small coffeetable. At the end of the room was french-door style of windows. Except the doors opened! There was a metal railing, for saftely I presume. That, too was wonderful. We almost always had that open, to get the air in. The drapes were controlled electronically, which my dad loved! There was a large flat screen tv mounted on the wall. The one problem with that was sound. They had controlled the sound so it could only go up to volume 14 (I guess to keep noise down), so you can't really hear some shows! But I fixed that by simply going up to the physical television to change the volume, and voila! All of the pops, water and teas were complimentary (everything except the alcohol). The only problem with that was that you had to either order ice, or wait for turn down service. (My dad didn't want to order ice, because then he would have to give the guy a tip!) The other great thing was the electronic "do no disturb" on the light panel. You simply have to press a button, and no one will disturb you! The location was amazing. Lovely choices of food in the area, and two blocks down from the hotel was a strip of stores that I love. On the block of the hotel, however were several higher-class stores (that I didn't want to spend so much on). It was definately a hot spot! Every night there were hundred-thousand dollar cars parked outside! I was amazed at the sound barriers. When the doors were open, the street life was inside the room! But as soon as your closed the doors, you couldn't hear a thing (unless someone came by with reaaly loud music! Of course, the price was high. But in my mind, everything about this hotel made the price worth it! I would definately stay at the Hazelton again!

Reviews.Title: “Deliciously romantic in the heart of Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: sn2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, great service (specially valet) and one of the best bar/lounge "One" situated at the lobby of the Hazelton Hotel. Location is ideal as it's in the heart of Yorkville however parking/driving can be a nuisance due to one way streets and the maze that Toronto Downtown is at times.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but get rid of the flies”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: The Hazleton is certainly fashionable (we saw a number of famous faces) and is well located for those who enjoy their shopping. The bathroom was really luxurious with lovely toiletries and the deepest bathtub we had ever seen. Yet somehow the hotel failed to deliver. The bedroom didn't get much natural light, but despite this the interior lighting never got above dim. The real problem though was the restaurant, which on our visit was buzzing with flies and the window sills littered with fly corpses.

Reviews.Title: “Special occasions call for special places...this one is it!”
Reviews.Author: TeamLR
Reviews.Content: My husband & I celebrated our 10 year anniversary at The Hazelton, I am so glad we decided on this place. Everything was spectacular, from valet, to check in, to room, spa the works. This place delivers. We were pleasantly surprised at check- in to receive a complimentary upgrade to a luxury king room. We also were impressed to see a tray of chocolate dipped strawberries with a kind note thanking us for choosing The Hazelton for our 10 year. Very impressed with the concierge service, we didn't have appts. booked at the spa but they were able to fit us in, couple's massage, which was so relaxing. This is the place to go, you won't be disappointed, worth every penny, you want for nothing, in fact, my husband said "I don't think they know how to say no!"

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Zaraselby
Reviews.Content: Truly there was no sour note in my stay. I pulled in and did a terrible job parallel parking --- halfway in the street -- doorman came and took my keys with a smile and took the car away. Bell man led to my room. Room seemed to have been formed just for me brand new. I was a little worried about the overly-mod decor but the room was low key enough that it was not an issue. Lobby a little much, thumpa thumpa music a little much. So two small sour notes. Vibrant evening scene in the restaurant. Veuve Cliquot in the mini bar. Price appalling but worth it. prior to my stay concierge set up my rental car at airport and arranged to let me drop it at the hotel. Etc etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel...Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy89
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights at the Hazelton Hotel in Toronto, I am now sold that this is the number one hotel in Canada. The hotel is located on the most exclusive street in Toronto, Yorkville Avenue. The lobby is gorgeous and the front door and desk staff surround the area always smiling and greeting me (most of the time by name always!). Upon check in, the staff who escorted me to my room gave me an overview of the features, including the bathroom floor warmers and the electronic drapes and lighting system. Absolutely the most luxurious and HUGE room I have ever stayed in! The restaurant is the perfect fit for the hotel. Very trendy atmosphere that stinks of wealth and class. It is very impressive, but I would recommend venturing out in Yorkville and trying some of the other fine restaurants. This hotel is now my number one choice for Toronto, for business or for pleasure. Well done team Hazelton. You put the Four Seasons to shame and have now won a very loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lap pool for lap dogs”
Reviews.Author: nowvoyager1
Reviews.Content: Toronto in the winter is nothing if not grey and unfortunately the dark tones and subdued lighting in the rooms gives the same feeling. It isn't helped by the building being a low rise and hence lacking any views which reinforces the gloom. However, rooms are well equipped and spacious. Bathrooms are well appointed with welcome underfloor heating and larger bottles of L'Occitane than one gets at other hotels ie the Four Seasons. Only had breakfast at the hotel and they score high marks for no dreaded buffet but fast and efficient table service. The bar gets quite crowded largely because all of the tables are against the walls, not making the best use of space but they mix a good cocktail and stock Chartreuse, seldom found these days in any bar. Top marks for that. I love a swim and need to do my 822m a day to rach my annual target, so with the promise of a lap pool, thought I would add to the tally. However, the deeply subterranean pool is easily mistaken for a foot bath and the photographs on the website are very misleading. It cannot be more than 8 metres, which hardly qualifies as a lap pool, as one good kick off and you're hitting the other end. Please be honest in your descriptions as it does not reflect well on management. Overall, it's a good hotel and a sound choice in a not particularly well served city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLover129
Reviews.Content: What to say about the Hazelton Hotel. First of all, its in a wonderful location (if you have deep pockets for shopping or just want to stay in Yorkville) and secondly the room was fantastic. The beds were really cozy and comfortable and the staff were really amazing and courteous without being pretentious. The bathrooms were really big and nice, great soaker tub too. Room service was always under 15 minutes no matter what you ordered, plus it always came from one of Toronto's best restaurants. WOW. Although on the pricey side, I would say you get just as good as value as anywhere else in Toronto, especially if you catch a deal. If you stay in Toronto, I would definitely choose the Hazelton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely; Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: misplacedmaritimer
Reviews.Content: The Hazelton is lovely, situated in the heart of Yorkville. We spent our first anniversary there and had a wonderful time. We were there the first weekend after New Years -- a typically slow time for hotels, as I understand it -- which is probably why they upgraded us at check-in. Our room was beautiful, with an amazing marble bathroom, and huge dressing area. The sleeping area was quite large as well, with enough room for two massage tables to be set-up (we had a couple massage in our room -- very nice!). The restaurant was delicious, and the service great. No complaints aside from the fact that the room backs on to an alleyway, and we could hear a delivery truck in the AM. This place isn't cheap, but worth it, especially as a little treat on your anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsS_09
Reviews.Content: Myself and my significant other chose the Hazelton to celebrate our anniversary and new years eve as well. check-in: 5 minutes after stepping out of our car at the valet, we were settled in our room and our bags were being brought in. Wow...did that really just happen??? Check-in was incredibly smooth, there was even an employee on the ground floor holding the elevator for us to go up, when the checking in process was complete. During the booking of our stay, hubby had mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary, and we were surprised to see a complimentary chilled bottle of champagne, chocolates, and a hand written note wishing us a happy anniversary and happy new year waiting for us in the room!! wow!! rooms: there was nothing left to be desired with the rooms. Very sleek and modern marble bathrooms with heated floors and a tv in the bathroom mirror. The bed was very comfortable and there was a complimentary pillow menu available. The hotel even offered to polish your shoes overnight!! We ordered room service for breakfast which was delicious and well worth it. Overall experience: The Hazelton advertises themself as a true 5* hotel in Toronto. The level of professionalism and service offered here lived up to our expectations. Prior to our check-in, we were debating between 2 restaurants for our anniversary dinner (neither was the restaurant in the hotel) and we emailed the concierge asking what they would recommend.
