We receievd a courteous response with information regarding both the restaurants. It is the little touches like this that set apart the Hazelton from other properties in Toronto. This hotel is gorgeous, beautifully furnished and I would reccomend it to anyone looking to indulge and celebrate a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Slightly pricey for overall value”
Reviews.Author: jjandeffie
Reviews.Content: The Hazelton is a great property catering to an obviously elite crowd. The location is very good as your steps from Bloor street and the trendy shops located within Yorkville. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed however I find the layout of the rooms similar to Le Germain which is about $200 a night cheaper. That said, Le Germain's location is no where as convenient as The Hazelton, therefore it may be worth the premium in price. The fitness center is tiny for a premium property such as this. The locker rooms are huge and I cannot understand for the life of me why the Hazelton would make such expansive locker rooms thereby limiting the size of the gym. the hotel service is fantastic and ONE restaurant provides for tasty and well prepared food choices. Be prepared though that breakfast at ONE is beyond a ridiculous rip off. The menu prices are almost gouging guests. Overall the property is well appointed, the service is fantastic and the location is unbeatable. I would recommend this property for business travelers and those looking for a romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: lapis986
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a total whim, was walking around in the neighbourhood and decided to rent a room. I had eaten in the restaurant (One) several times before, so I was looking forward to the room service at the very least. The room I got was excellent, and I'd say the best features were the luxurious bathroom with heated floors, as well as the electric blinds. The room (standard King) wasn't very large and the view was poor, but everything else was top-notch. I've stayed in many hotels in Toronto, and this is easily the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RC161
Reviews.Content: Toronto does not have a wealth of fine hotels but this is the best. Large room, very well appointed. A little over-trendy but basically all made of good stuff - marble bathroom, massive bath, nice towels and robe etc. Free water and soft drinks. 24 hour room service and free wifi which works well. Basically everything you want from a city hotel. I'm used to staying downtown which seems a bit more real, but got used to Yorkville pretty quick. It's a bit like uptown New York vs downtown... bit more Gucci/Prada etc but still great cinema round the corner and good food close by. Had a fantastic deep tissue massage from a guy called Nile who was really excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Luxury Hotel That Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveller49
Reviews.Content: The celebration of our ten year wedding anniversary will be fondly remembered due in large part to our fantastic stay at the Hazelton Hotel. The staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful. Our spaciuos room was equipped with modern amenities, quality furnishings, a luxurious bathroom complete with heated floors and large soaker tub. The design of the hotel was very appealing maintaining a neutral pallette throughout. We enjoyed the attention to detail, evident in such things as remote controlled blinds, room doorbell, privacy indicator light, slippers, plush robes, complimentary water, soft drinks, tea and coffee, television displayed in bathroom mirror...we could go on and on. The area surrounding the Hazelton is also very welcoming and has a variety of excellent shops, restaurants and attractions. If you are seeking a luxury stay, look no further than the Hazelton Hotel. Our only disappointment was having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars well deserved”
Reviews.Author: MLKNN
Reviews.Content: I've been to many 5 star hotels in north america, europe and middle east. This hotel's attention to detail is simply the best. The staff are very professional, the room service is incredibly quick and the food is delicious. Everything non-alcoholic in the minibar is complementary and so is the internet. The bedding is heavenly soft and the wood and stone finishes in the room and the bathroom are tasteful and well done. Of course you pay for all of this, but compared to some other places I've been, this one's well worth its stars and dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool - to die for food and service”
Reviews.Author: DaniPLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hazleton suite, which was huge! It was like our own apartment. The deco is super cool, very dark and demure. The bathroom had 2 x showers, 2 x sinks, and one huge bath tub. Every time we ordered food, it came super quick, and they would serve us like we were in the restaurant, bringing up the food per course. The food was also amazing - best room service I have ever had. I have stayed in the best hotels in the world, and I can say that the service here is the best I have ever experienced. The staff are very competent. The atmosphere is super chic. Yorkville is also lovely, and very quant. I loved it :) We return to this hotel every time we are in Toronto :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EQuesnel
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel, front desk person was very friendly and welcoming. Got to my room, trendy and very comfortable. The hotel is well located for my business needs and the Concierge refer me to a great restaurant where I was greet by my name! Probably the magic touch of the concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Sloppy customer service”
Reviews.Author: itinerantHongKong
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing this review but am doing so now almost one year later because the more I travel at comparable hotels, the more I feel compelled to speak out against the way that I and my family was treated by The Hazelton Hotel staff. I never stayed here, so I cannot comment on the rooms or facilities. What I can say is that I booked a room here for my mother months in advance (and pre-paid via credit card), as I was scheduled to travel elsewhere during her trip to Toronto. I paid for daily breakfast and asked them to be sure that she knew the location and times. They never told her. I also asked them to do all they could to make her feel comfortable, as she is older and rarely travels. In fact, they barely had the time of day for the one or two questions she had. On top of this, on the night before she was to check in, a staff member sent me an email saying they had to re-process my credit card and if I didn't call them back the room would be cancelled. (This was after they had confirmed to me that all was fine.) I was working in Africa at the time where there were no landlines or stable Internet connections, but still in a panic for my mother I did my best to get through to them, which took me hours. When eventually we spoke (on my cell phone after I was able to recharge it and at my cost) it took more back and forth over a period of hours before the matter was sorted - or at least I had hoped it was. I went to sleep at 3 am without any confirmation from them, or even so much as an apology. It is not trendy, splashy rooms and an expensive price that makes a hotel luxurious - these are just the window dressing for the impeccable service and professionalism that a client expects when s/he shells out a tidy sum. To this day, I cannot believe the manner in which we as clients were treated. The irony is that the hotel I was staying in at the time in the Congo (at a fraction of the price) was up against some serious logistic and infrastructure challenges and still managed to care for me like I mattered. Now one year later, I sincerely hope The Hazelton has learned to make the most out of all it has going for it. It is however too late for me, as you can be sure I will be staying at and recommending the nearby Four Seasons and Park Hyatt, neither of which has ever let me down.

Reviews.Title: “Super dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: Transperancy
Reviews.Content: So, here's the deal: the Hazelton has good service and the location is great. However, half the rooms are REALLY dark facing another building. The dark colors of the rooms make it much worse. You cannot really tell that from their web site, so you kind of have to come stay once, figure out which room category is the right one to book, then come back. Not a great experience. Having said that, Toronto does not have great hotels to begin with, so not sure where to stay. I don't fully comprehend why so many mega cities cannot get a couple of great hotels. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best....Period”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler72
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at the Hazelton with my Fiancee this past weekend. Coming from NYC, where there are many fine hotels, I can honestly say that the Hazelton far exceeds any other establishment we have stayed at in the world. Top notch service, with attention to detail in the little things that really put it over the top. Not to mention rooms that are out of this world and unbelieveable breakfast! It is worth going to Toronto just to stay at this hotel alone.

Reviews.Title: “Im think i'm in love”
Reviews.Author: iwillis
Reviews.Content: First of all it's a 5 star. amazing. outstanding service. heated floors. giant bathtub. balcony view of toronto's hot spots.... did i mention the remote control blinds? the bed was fantastic & the lobster spoons were incredible.... I will be back. well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: bdextravels
Reviews.Content: I was brought to Toronto on business, but I now plan on returning for pleasure. And when I do, I plan on staying at The Hazelton. Their guest rooms are exceptionally stylish and you feel like a celebrity as soon as you walk in the lobby. The location in the Yorkville area gives an abundance of shopping, nightlife, and dining options. I stayed on a Wednesday and I was suprised to see how busy the bar, lounge, and restaurant were. Even so, the dining service was prompt and the food extraordinary good. I wish I could have stayed longer, but all the more reason to visit there again. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants 5 Star Service with in a trendy and exciting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate!”
Reviews.Author: OftenTravelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves the great reviews it receives and its difficult to understand the poor reviews. The location cannot be beat. Its a new hotel that has got everything right. Service is amenable and efficient. Food quality is top of the game. Have stayed at the Four Seasons across the street a number of times and it has nothing on the Hazelton. And that's saying something because the Four Seasons is one of the standard bearers for a great experience. In my book, its the Hazelton or the Four Seasons in Toronto. The rest are merely ok rather than great. In a sense, the Hazelton can be preferred from the perspective of more of a boutique hotel rather than an institution. The high speed wifi is excellent with high bandwidth for downloads. You don't find this everywhere! Really, I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay during the Film Festival”
Reviews.Author: tcoop92
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hip hotel, stayed here because were so anxious for the opening and during the Film Festival for a reason. We got a special deal and reserved using a promo code and got a beautiful Executive Suite. It was brand new and extremely spacious. All grey, very old Hollywood glam! ONE restaurant by mark mcewan, is one of the hottest restaurants in Toronto. We ate all three meals there over the time of our stay, breakfast, lunch and dinner. Also had Sunday Brunch the next week (but was not staying there) and went to the Tasting Room for dinner with a group of friends. Every time, the restaurant was absolutely amazing, whether sitting outside under the heating lamps at night or inside the hip and chic dining room. It is the place to be! I didn't get to try the Spa but swam in the Indoor Pool. Lastly, great location (just down the street from the Four Seasons Hotel and Sassafraz, one of our fav restaurants and went for dinner there during our stay as well) Would highly recommend and go back! to the Hazelton and Sassafraz!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: At this kind of price you have to be superb and the Hazelton almost pulled it off. Since I was here on business the room was the most important thing and the rooms are excellent - I was in one of the luxury rooms on the 2nd floor - enormous black marble bathrooms with a TV screen embedded in the mirror and a tub about 3 feet deep. The bed was wonderful. Only gripes were the light in the bathroom that would not switch off (a feature not a fault) and doors into the bathroom which trapped my fingers twice. Also it was a shame I could not use the nice little balcony because of building work going on above, Outside the room I thought the staff were fine. I tried to use the bar but it was heaving so had to give up. The gym is fine of a bit small for a hotel of this quality. The area is hip (rather like the hotel) but has a good range of restaurants and shops within walking distance and easy access to the subway for downtown. Defintely worth staying at if you can get a reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoensam
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hazelton and it was everything I hoped for and more. The junior suite I had was beautiful, and the staff were incredibly professional. Absolutely nothing was a problem. I've stayed in many hotels throughout the world and this was one of the best. I needed stockings urgently early one morning and no stores were open...concierge had some. Little business centre on every floor. Room service was quick and food was great, and there are also plenty of good restaurants within 2 blocks of the hotel. When I was leaving, they offered me a bottle of water for my journey....and that was hours after I'd checked out (I'd gone back to retrieve my bags). Town car provided for me to get to meeting one morning. Though it costs more than most Toronto hotels, you really do get a fair bit more for the money....great rooms and impeccable service. It would be my first choice place to stay at in Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “This is Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one of the best city hotels I've stayed, period. It really reminded me of Four Seasons Hotel in NYC but imagine more personalized and chic! The room was spacious, the bathroom was exactly how I would love to remodel my home bathroom if budget was limitless, the staff were attentive but not in your face. I stayed there on business, but wished I was there just for pleasure. The desk had two chairs which I thought was a nice touch, I always find when I stay in hotels with similar layout I move the desk chair around to face the other way then to find it moved back after the room was cleaned. Lots of power outlets by the desk, no need to crawl under the desk to plug your laptop. I loved the big Vogue book and interior decor book, nice touch! The fridge was stocked with complimentary soft drinks and bottled water, there were three different kinds of tea plus a kettle - nice not to have to use the coffee machine to make hot water. Fresh milk and cream in the fridge, I've stayed in deluxe hotels that still carry the scary powdered milk but you won't find that at the Hazelton. The bathroom was absolutely lovely. The TV had great sound system so you can hear it even while the water was running. Everything was so luxe, thick bathrobes, Bulgari amenities, marble everywhere (almost wiped out in the shower a few times), deep soaker tubs... Make up mirror was very useful. I tried room service and also dined in One Restaurant. Room service was very prompt, food came very hot and presentation was very nice. The restaurant was packed even though I dined on a Tuesday night. Service in the restaurant was great in general except for the server assigned to our table, he kept getting our orders confused and was quite rude. Other servers seemed to try to pick up his mistakes and apologize for him. Food was fabulous but portion was small considering they were sharing plates. There was a great buzz in the restaurant throughout the night, it is definitely a great place for cocktails with friends as well as for power dinners / client entertaining. Room attendants called me by my name, they were all very attentive and pleasant. Concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. Location was fantastic, if you need to go downtown it is a bit of a hike and taxi bills added up. Many taxi drivers didn't know about the hotel and I had to explain to them how to get there numerous times. I travel to Toronto very frequently, now I have a new favourite hotel. So many hotels nowadays call themselves "boutique" but in fact they are just boutique-style. This hotel is a true luxury boutique hotel, intimate, personalized, stylish in a tasteful fashion in a fabulous location. If my budget permits I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hazelton Hotel - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MerryTP
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent place to stay. Just the two of us, without kids, so we really enjoyed the sophistication and style of this hotel. The location was fine, plenty of upscale shopping nearby. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly, efficient or helpful. We would stay here again in the blink of an eye!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cam2000
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Stunning design, sleek and modern but comfortable. Such great service. Every request was more that fulfilled. The rooms were extremely comfortable. The bed was dreamy, the bath enormous. Easily my favorite hotel in Canada. One restaurant is incredible. Great food and scene. Not cheap but worth it for the extra special details.

Reviews.Title: “Nice job Hazelton”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with amazing decor, feel and has great staff. Perfect location in the heart of Yorkville, 5 stars all the way. Great job Hazelton, keep up the great work. Good points: - Perfect location - Small size hotel and is new unlike the other hotels in TO - It is the â€œitâ€� hotel to stay in Toronto and even in Canada - You almost feel like you are in a cool European hotel - Cool bathrooms - Nice pool and spa - but should have outdoor areas to enjoy for guest - but very nice pool - Amazing bath rooms with a very cool look - Good beds â€“ very cozy and elegant - Nice art work within the hotel - Best new rooms in TO - Very clean hotel - Good staff - Nice lobby area with an ultra cool vibe Other things to keep in mind - It is not a high rise hotel, therefore the views or just al right - It is new but not Four Seasons prefect - ONE (the hotel's dining room) - is just ok, it has the service and looks but food is only so so - Very pricy $$$, restaurant prices where outrages ($7.00 for a glass of OJ, $20.00 for French toast plus taxes and service charges, in my option itâ€™s not worth it. All in all very nice! We will come back. It was all good, but we can wait until the new Four Seasons opens up, that will be the best hotel in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Black Lab Nickie
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hazelton Hotel after reading a review of the hotel in NY Times Travel section. It is a fairly new hotel; it opened last year. Although the staff was friendly, they appeared so inexperienced that when we encountered some problems, they were not able to solve them. Our room was very warm; on the first night, it stayed above 72F. We called the front desk who informed us that they would cool it centrally but that did not work. The next morning, we were eager to solve this problem. The engineer came to the room and suggested that we turned off all the lights. They also offered to put us in another room (the hotel was quite empty) but the three rooms that they showed us were smaller and less appealing than the one we were in. After much discussions and attempts, they were eventually able to cool the room to a comfortable temperature. The room was nice but the amenities in the bathroom and (free) minibar were inadequate for a hotel that is trying to be the "best" in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: viperqueen
Reviews.Content: My 14-year old son and I have stayed at many exceptional hotels throughout the world. But every year, we book a great hotel in our own city, Toronto, become tourists, and take advantage of the many things the city has to offer. This year we decided to stay at The Hazelton Hotel. How many times did we each say, "I love this hotel!"? It is, by far, the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Our adventure began with a huge state-of-the-art double room, at what I now consider an exceptional price, of a size that other hotels would call a suite, with (as you'll read in other reviews) a fabulous large marble bathroom with heated flooring and so many other amenities. This hotel has been built with today's state-of-art electronics, and every element takes advantage of that. Buttons for whatever you want to change (drapes, lighting, security). There is no "please do not disturb" sign to hang on the doorknob. It's electronic, calling for maid service or privacy. There's a huge swiveling flat screen. But I also noticed that the features are built with quality. The cabinetry is precise. The dressing area, outside the fabulous bathroom, is perfect in size, storage, and function. And then there's the bed (in our case, two). So beyond comfortable that my son had trouble motivating me to leave it our first morning there, even though we were determined to get a fairly early start. So the design and execution of the rooms are perfect. We had dinner at their restaurant "ONE". We solicited the help of our server to make choices that we would most enjoy. As in all exceptional restaurants, "server" doesn't do the position justice. Dinner was fabulous. ONE also has a concept that, of course, you will want to share tasting with your dinner companions. Worked perfectly for us. The best thing about the hotel (and remember, we are talking about an extremely high standard, given the room and ONE) was the excellence of the staff. To begin with, I walked in and was checked in so quickly without having to give my name. Of course I had to ask, "How did you know who I was?". According to my son, the valet read my name from my luggage tag, and said in his headset (technology, technology), "(My Name) is coming in now." They were all ready for me. What a grand surprise. Then we were guided to our room and given a brief but comprehensive tour. I went toward my purse to provide a tip, but was told, "No, no, totally unnecessary." And I felt that -- I had been guided by someone with pride of ownership, although I am fairly certain this was not the owner. My son and I were in the room when staff did turndown service and I couldn't believe the effort that was made. Pillows on our luxurious beds flattened just so, duvets pulled down just so, everything tidied just so. It speaks to the effort, but transparency that goes into every detail. I'm sure some guests don't interact with the staff as much as we did. That's a shame, since they were anticipating our every need, and doing their utmost to make our stay all the better. Whatever they could do for us, they did. I so much enjoyed the conversations I had with a few of them. They were professional, talented and engaging. Did I mention? I loved this hotel. In my mind, the best in TO, small or large, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE!”
Reviews.Author: SHOWHOST
Reviews.Content: The Hazelton Hotel Is Fairly New But When I Stayed There, There Was No Experience Comparable. I Was On A Red Eye the Night Prior and Had 2 Hours Sleep. I Could Not Check Into The Hotel Until After 3:00 Pm. I Went To The Spa And The Manager Linda McDonald-Ferris And Angela Was All Too Kind In Treating Me Like A Star! She And Her Colleague Put A Smile On My Face And All Of My Worries Disappeared. The Quality of the Facial Was the Best I've Ever Experienced and the State-Of-The Art Facilities Were Amazing! This Boutique Hotel Has A Staff That Aimed To Please In Every Possible Way! The Luxurious Bathroom And Entire Room Was Electronically Controlled From The Lighting To Warming The Marble Floors In The Bathroom. The Concierge Rhonda Went Out Of Her Way To Assist Me. I Could Have Stayed In The Room My Whole Trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is where to Stay in TORONTO!!!”
Reviews.Author: prettybaby30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hazelton with a friend on Feb 16th and let me tell you this is the hotel to stay in when you are in Toronto. I live just outside Toronto and was staying there for a girls night away. I have stayed in many hotels but none compare to this one. I had a few special requests I asked of the hotel for my friend and they cam through and were so helpful. The staff is amazing and they do make you feel like a movie star. the room was beautiful and the bathroom was anyones dream!!! huge tub and the shower OMG I have never seen a more heavenly shower! they had a rain shower head that came from the ceiling and the water pressure was amazing! the bathrooms have heated floors and you get fluffy bathrobes! The room service was amazing but it is a la cart so you have to get everything seperate. Try the fries they are devine! The bed and pillows are so relaxing I wish I could have stayed at the hotel forever! This is my hotel of choice from now on and the place to stay in Toronto! I have a birthday coming up and I am going to book with this Hotel again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: toronto_living_2008
Reviews.Content: Living in Toronto, and desperate for a romantic night away from the kids, my wife and I decided that the Hazelton Hotel would be the destination for a valentines day get-away. From the moment that we checked in, the staff made us feel like royalty. The room was fantastic, and we could have spent the entire stay in the bathroom alone. Who needs a spa when you have a chic, marble throughout facility in your own room? (they have a spa too, which, while we didn't use it, looked quite nice). We had dinner in the area, and a few cocktails in the hotel bar, the atmosphere was electric and the crowd was quite intriging. When we retired to our room, champagne was delivered and we were able to take full advantage of its luxury. The television is huge, the couch is cozy, the bed is amazing, the blinds are automatic and again, the bathroom is worth the stay alone. Everything we needed was right at our fingertips, and delivered quickly and without compromise by the pleasant staff. The breakfast was absolutely devine and when we wanted to extend our stay, a much later check-out was granted to us without any question. All-in-all, my wife and I had so much fun that we've decided to be tourists in our own city as often as possible, and it's quite likely that we'll be reliving this trip again by staying at the Hazelton Hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel (and already have) to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: nevr_at_home
Reviews.Content: Presently I am writing this review from my room. The business services at the hotel are exceptional. The concierge team has done a great job of recommending various Toronto sights (and given me hours of operation). But the best part about my stay has been eating at ONE. I called ahead to book by reservation in the dining room (I recommend doing the same as they book out, and donâ€™t hold tables for the hotel guests; I witnessed other guests being turned away). There was still a wait to get our table, but I spent the time in the lounge. What a great atmosphere. The bar staff were beyond efficient and the drinks were amazing. The hostess came and found us in the bar to show us to our table. The food was incredible, and the service was perfect. This morning I am happily enjoying room service, these guys know what they are doing. I am paying $450 for the room (not bad for a Saturday night in Toronto with a stunning room) If checkout is anything but perfection Iâ€™ll let you know.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with a few flaws.”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoneymooners
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. We stayed in a deluxe king room which was spacious with a large wardrobe area and a divine bathroom. The bathroom was probably what I liked best about the room, it has great features like under floor heating and a TV built into the mirror, the over sized tub was also lovely. The room decor was gorgeous (much like the rest of the hotel), very sleek and modern, and also incredibly clean. The room has a large flat screen TV, DVD player and free high speed Internet, which were all a nice touch to the room. Each room has a complimentary minibar, however there is only water, tea/coffee and three different types of soda. It was nice to have some free beverages but there were no snacks or alcoholic beverages, if you wanted these you had to call room service to have them delivered to your room, the selection was small and very overpriced, and with some of the alcoholic beverages you had to purchase a full sized bottle. I would have preferred to have a regular well stocked mini bar than the few complimentary beverages in the hotel's current minibar. The room service menu (with the exception of the late night menu) comes from the hotel's restaurant 'One'. The menu was varied and the food at One is good, however it's expensive, which isn't helped by the hotel charging guests a CAD$5 delivery fee for room service (on top of the 17% gratuity they add). Our hotel room faced on to the lane behind the hotel, which firstly wasn't pretty to look at but also was very noisy each morning, so anyone considering this hotel should make sure they're not overlooking this alley. The apartments on top of the hotel are not complete yet so there was also construction noise, so this is another thing anyone considering staying at the hotel in the near future might want to consider. On a more positive note the hotel staff are amazingly friendly and helpful, I honestly couldn't praise them enough. Overall the hotel was comfortable and in a great location. I would stay at this hotel again, but I'd definitely be making sure I had a room facing Yorkville Ave or Hazelton Lane!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarajane
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just stayed at the hazelton for a weekend getaway. It was fabulous from start to finish. The decor was amazing ( as a interior decorator i am very critical and i absolutely loved it), the food at the restaurant and room service super yummy, and the service helpful and friendly. A perfectly modern but cozy hotel. I could not possibly think of one thing to complain about except the loud group arriving back to their rooms at 4:00 am!!! also note- the mini bar that is stocked is complimentay- you can request a fully stocked mini bar brought up to the room anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hazleton is for hte birds...”
Reviews.Author: sderekw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hazleton last Thursday through Sunday. When we arrived, we were taken to our room ($675/night) and shown around. The website mentioned that the hotel had balconies, but this room didn't. We asked to be moved, and the only room availble was a smaller room on the second floor -- but it did have a balcony. it took them almost 30 minutes to move us. We were told that the bathroom would be the same, but when we switched, it wasn't even close. But whatever, at least we had our balcony... Then we noticed the nonexistent mini bar. Only ginger ale, soda, and diet soda in the room. anything else has to be delivered by room service (i had 2 cans of club soda delived -- $2.75/can, plus delivery charge, plus 17% -- $14.00). Our balcony faced an alley that is used for emptying dumpsters, so our 2nd floor balcony was miserable to sit on. and on friday night, we sat out there for a smoke / drink after dinner and there was some kind of soot that covered the entire balcony. somehow all of the other 2nd floor balconies had their seat cusions covered, but ours did not, and i'm hoping that our clothes will come clean. the hotel staff said they had never heard of this before - -so tell me why the other balconies had been covered??? the restaurant, one, is awful. the appetizers and salads were average at best. i ordered the huse specialty (braised ontario rabbit) and had to send it back. not only did it arrive 10 minutes before my wife's entree, it was cold, tough, and had no flavor -- basically like eating a soggy piece of cardboard. the truffle risotto side wasn't even close -- basically tasted like a lipton instant risotto pack. bad truffles too. i asked our waiter what was goinig on in the kitched for their signature dish to be bad, and he said that mark (the owner / chef) was never at the restaurant and that the onsite chef didn't know how to run a kitchen properly. i asked our waiter if he could point us in the right direction for nearby jazz club, and he recommended we go to nawlins, just a short taxi ride away. when we arrived, the club he suggested was a tourist trap -- filled with typical fat american tourists wearing eagles' jerseys / cheap jeans / etc. my wife was in marni cocktail dress and i was in a zegna coat -- we were looking for a nice night out. i'm quite certain that the other patrons at nawlins idea of a nice night was cheap beer / cheese fries special. it was a horrible suggestion. of course, the concierge's recommendations weren't any better... the next day we lunch we asked for a nice french restaurant nearby -- the concierge suggested bistro 990, and it was about a 20 minute walk. my wife and i walked all the way to the restaurant -- only to find that it was not open for lunch. i would never recommend this hotel. bad service, bad advice, no attention to detail -- mediocrity at it's finest. heck, they only provided turn-down service on one of the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Service??? What service!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiffqueen
Reviews.Content: For a hotel giving itself a 5* rating before even opening, quite gutsy!!! I would give service a 1*. After waiting at the not busy bar for half a hour just to even be noticed was a little too much to start. One little hint, ask for directions on how to use the faucet in the bathroom before attempting to turn the little knob. Overall, not friendly and quite a cold atmosphere. Not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute joke. Toronto wake up.”
Reviews.Author: torontovisitor64
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller to Toronto and live in New York. I usually stay in the Yorkville area and for the past couple of years I have been hearing about this new hotel, Hazelton, that is supposed to be the first 5 star property in Toronto. Well, on my visit this weekend, they were finally open so my associate and I decided to give it a try. To be clear, there is nothing 5 star here. Try maybe 2. They try to be hip and cool in the design, but instead it is a disjointed attempt to be hip. Its cold and boring. The service is a farce. room service from some fancy chef took an hour and tasted like some fast food order. Later we saw this chef sitting with customers in the restaurant drinking. Maybe he should be in the kitchen. I love the Yorkville location where this place is but this pl;ace is bookended with a kids club on one side, a construction zone on the other and a cheap loud pub accross the street. And if that was not bad enough, the hotel's restaurant patio is one floor below the rooms, creating noise till very late. The finishing touch were the two dozen or so Harleys in the front at midnight. Stay away. This place is a joke. When checking out I tried to explain my displeasure. This was met with some manager's condesending comments, still calling it Toronto's only 5 star property. So I asked how did they get the rating? He was truthfull enough to admit that they actually have not yet been rated but they hoped to be 5 star. Talk about misleading advertising. Well, at least there is consistency here. Never again.
